author: Lotte Duncan
method: Gently rinse over the elderflowers to remove any dirt or little creatures.  Pour the boiling water over the sugar in a very large mixing bowl. Stir well and leave to cool.  Add the citric acid, the orange and lemon slices, and then the flowers.  Leave in a cool place for 24 hours, stirring occasionally.  Strain through some muslin and transfer to sterilised bottles.
ingredients: 30 elderflower heads ,  1.7litres/3 pints boiling water ,  900g/2lb caster sugar ,  50g/2oz citric acid (available from chemists) ,  2 unwaxed oranges, sliced,  3 unwaxed lemons, sliced
